original: LINDHOLM, Jöns Uno Theodor, Direktör, Stockholm, f Sthlm 18/3 00 av snick.m J L o Charlotta Karlsson, gm Sylvia Lundgren. Studex Sthlm 19, HHS 21, stud.stip f Argentina. Anst Sthlms stads statist kont 21—23, Sthlms Borgarsk 21—23, Nord Komp Buenos Aires 24, Armour of Brasil Corp Sao Paulo 25, The Atlantic Refining Co of Brasil Sao Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Rio Grande o Santos 20—28, The B F Goodrich Co Sao Paulo 29, Akron (Ohio) o Köpenhamn 30, Sthlm 31—37. Vkst dir AB Uno Lindholm & Co sed. 38, vkst dir Sv Sportfabr AB sed. 39, Nord Elektriko AB sed. 41, AB Träemballage o AB Volator sed. 42. Resor: Argent, Paraguay, Brasil, Centralam, USA, Engl, Tyskl, Holl, Belg, Frankr, Span, Port, Marocko, Norge, Danm, Finl, Estl. AB Uno Lindholm & Co är repr f British Tire & Rubber Co o ett flert amerik fmor i flygbr. Sed. 39 har fmans rör utvidg t såväl exp s iinp av spec maskiner, järn, stål o papper.
translated: LINDHOLM, Jöns Uno Theodor, Director, Stockholm, born in Stockholm on March 18, 1900, to carpenter J L and Charlotta Karlsson. Married to Sylvia Lundgren. Studied at Stockholm University in 1919, and at HHS (probably Handelshögskolan, Stockholm School of Economics) in 1921. Received a scholarship to study in Argentina. Employed at Stockholm City Statistics Office from 1921 to 1923, Stockholm Borgarsk (citizen's school) from 1921 to 1923, Nord Komp (company) Buenos Aires in 1924, Armour of Brasil Corp Sao Paulo in 1925, The Atlantic Refining Co of Brasil in Sao Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Rio Grande, and Santos from 1920 to 1928. Worked for The B F Goodrich Co in Sao Paulo in 1929, Akron (Ohio), and Copenhagen in 1930, and in Stockholm from 1931 to 1937. Became a managing director at AB Uno Lindholm & Co in 1938, and at Sv Sportfabr AB in 1939, Nord Elektriko AB in 1941, AB Träemballage and AB Volator in 1942. Traveled to Argentina, Paraguay, Brasil, Central America, USA, England, Germany, Holland, Belgium, France, Spain, Portugal, Morocco, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Estonia. AB Uno Lindholm & Co represents British Tire & Rubber Co, as well as several American aircraft manufacturers. Since 1939, the company has expanded its import and export activities of specialized machinery, iron, steel, and paper.
